content: In Paris brasseries and restaurants, asking for the bill: « L'addition, s'il vous plaît ». To split the bill: « On peut payer séparément ? » or « On partage l'addition ? ». Service is included (service compris); rounding up or leaving small change is polite but not mandatory.
Tipping in France: service is included. It's customary to leave a few euros or round up. No need for 15–20% like in the US.
Paris Metro: buy a carnet (10 tickets) or use Navigo. Validate your ticket at the entrance. « Un carnet, s'il vous plaît » at the counter.
Museums: book online when possible (Louvre, Orsay). « Un billet pour aujourd'hui » — one ticket for today. EU under-26 often free with ID.
Café: « Un café » is espresso. « Un café crème » is with milk. « Un déca » is decaf. « L'addition » when you want to pay.
